sub_title: Head of Key clients - Business Developer- Head of Customer Experience- Head of Warehousing & Dist. - LATAM
summary:
Senior logistics executive with 13 year of experience in Supply chain, Key account management, stakeholder management Warehousing & Distribution with regional scope. 
Focused on driving company’s profitability and growth through strategic planning as well as developing strong commercial relationships with customers and vendors. 

Strongly motivated on developing people, business and finding end to end solutions to ensure customer and company goals are achieved.

profile_positions.description: In charge of the all HUB operations (IB) for Spares parts Division, from factories to Distribution (OB) in Latin America for Subsidiaries, Distributors and other type of customers across the Region, keeping an efficient and agile Logistic cost structure  ensuring items are available everywhere at the right time within top class Lead Times.
profile_positions.title: Regional Logistics Manager -  Latin America

profile_positions.description:
Main responsibilities:

Product Management:

•	Owner of regional P&L for Warehousing and Distribution products
•	Manage local Warehousing and Distribution products within framework
•	Regional ownership of defined Warehousing and Distribution related KPIs
•	Grow Warehousing and Distribution footprint in region through constant review in order to enable profitable growth


Regional customer engagement 

•	Support and ownership of Warehousing and Distribution as part of supply chain solution design
•	Proivde sales support for Warehousing and Distribution in region
•	Lead regional tender response for Warehousing and Distribution
•	Lead local opportunity management
•	Develop tender pricing within established framework


Collaboration

•	Support joint venture framework and Joint venture management
•	Regional execution and support of transformation progress
•	Drive program benefit realization
•	Support feedback loop on innovation
•	Provide support and regional ownership of idea process
•	Lead Regional Design Thinking workshops and processes

Main Achievements:

•Create Product Strategy, awareness and processes organization after the inclusion of the logistics area within shipping in the Maersk Group for Latin America.
•Build the footprint of Latin America for the next 5 years, to ensure the expansion plan in the region including the needs of the organization to achieve the growth plan i.e build special sales force with special know how and target growth based on countries capabilities as well as investments to be developed.
•20% GP growth of existing portfolio vs LY

Position reporting to Business Unit Director
Direct reports: dotted line 5


Business or sector Logistics and Supply Chain
profile_positions.title: Regional Head of Warehousing & Distribution - Latin America

profile_positions.description:
Developing and driving the Supply Chain and Value-Added Services product strategy in the area. Commercialization and implementation of the Warehousing product portfolio including all contract logistics related services as well as last mile delivery in his area.


Main Responsibilities:

-P&L ownership of Supply Chain and Value-Added Services products.
-Responsible for managing the development and/or introduction of innovation/new services and solutions based on local market/customer needs through market analysis.
-Working with commercial teams the best solutions to our customers through appropriate direct and indirect support, including development of customized solutions where strategically required to differentiate beyond standard offerings

Position reporting to Business Unit Director
Direct reports: dotted line 5

Business or sector Logistics and Supply Chain

Main Achievements:

-Cope with the date to date activities by managing three roles simultaneously during the company’s transition
-P&L ownership of Supply Chain and Value-Added Services products.
-Responsible for managing the development and/or introduction of innovation/new services and solutions based on local market/customer needs through market analysis.
-Working with commercial teams the best solutions to our customers through appropriate direct and indirect support, including development of customized solutions where strategically required to differentiate beyond standard offerings
profile_positions.title: Area Head of Supply Chain Management, Warehousing and Value Added Services

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for service delivery for the global or regional accounts with Central and South America. Key focus areas of the Area Head of Program Management are service delivery, productivity and profitability, people development and leadership of the Area Program Management community. 

PM function serves a much diversified portfolio for industries such as: Petroleum, sports apparel, fashion retail, Agribusiness, personal care products. 
Direct Reports: 8 (locations: Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Panama & Guatemala)
Annual portfolio’s revenue 5 million USD. 

Main responsibilities:

Productivity and Profitability  
-Establish profitability (CCM) measurements for the accounts in scope – at least within the area 
-Drive productivity improvements for the accounts and enable sharing across accounts
-Review global operational processes and validate possibilities of cost reduction against service delivery level for accounts in scope
-Review procedures that will minimize company exposure to risk associated with compliance, trade controls and HSSE

People Development and achievments
-Team structuring and implement the vertical focus within the Area PM team
-Provide coaching within Area PM team to drive engagement 
-Conduct regular talent reviews jointly with HR
-Ensure to have a succession pipeline in place for PM community 

Innovation, Collaboration & Community Development
  
-Engage with Commercial and Operational experts on Global/Regional/Area level to explore new developments servicing the changes in customer demand
-Participate in and host Lesson Learned workshops with the global and regional Program Management community and ensure best practice is defined, distributed and available to all global accounts
-Ensure to participate in designing and rolling out one set of global, internal KPIs (across accounts) covering the majority of customer requirements 

Position reporting to: Area Chief Operating officer (COO)
Total Company employees: 8 in frontline
Direct Reports: 8
profile_positions.title: Area Head of Key Clients - Program Management - Central & South America

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the End to End Customer Experience in Costa Rica, Dominican Republic and Panama for the Care and care Premium Customers, including HIT Ratio from closed/ won opportunities up to Loaded cargo, booking, manifests, international transit, documentation and release. Also, in charge of NPS and Loyalty Satisfaction across the countries under scope of work. Responsible of Global Projects for Simplification and Outsourced Tasks in the GLOBAL SERVICE CENTERS (Offshored offices located in India, China and The Philippines). 

Responsible to secure best in the industry service level to all the countries yearly budget as per following details: Panama 30,000 FFE’s, (forty-foot equivalent unit) Costa Rica 25,000 & Dominican Republic 18000 FFE’s.

Management & Growth strategy
-Work closely with Project Management team to establish Infrastructure, Team and Processes
-Manage budgets and cost.
-Drive and own improvements in processes and productivity

Manage human capital
-Set up a robust organization by identifying and recruiting the required talent.
-Develop an effective leadership pipeline 
-Promote skills development of team through robust resource planning/headcount optimization via training initiatives.

Stakeholder management
-Facilitate smooth interface between all teams and retain organization staff at all levels
-Ensure effective communication to staff on new initiatives
-Position reporting to: Cluster Customer Service Manager

Total Company employees: 8 in frontline/ 6 in Global Service Centers
Direct Reports: 8
profile_positions.title: Customer Experience Premium Segment Manager - Caribbean Area

profile_positions.description:
Main responsibilities
Responsible for the transition within the company and the team during a highly volatile year for the seafreight industry. Main achievement was able to deploy all initiatives planned, ensure business continuity and implementation of the Customer Call Centre based in Panama created to attend to all customers from Venezuela, Dominican Republic, Panama, Costa Rica and Colombia.

-Responsible for the Caribbean Sea Cluster Customer Satisfaction and NPS (highest in the world for three consecutive quarters)
-Responsible to secure best in the industry service level to all the cluster countries yearly Rofo (Rolling forecast) 220,000 FFE’s, (forty-foot equivalent unit) 14 countries in scope. 
-Interim member of the Cluster Leadership Team
-Position reporting to: Cluster Top and Center Business Partner

Main achievements:

-Successful implementation of an ambitions centralization project that gathered the largest customer tier (80%) in 1 country location, this project required, standardization of of more than 25 core processes, project plan of countries workload migration to a new service location, recruiting a team of 15 members (including associates, supervisors and Managers).

-Implementation and adoption of a global CRM that enabled visibility across the organization and functions of customer’s main issues, no, of interactions per customer / process, commercial opportunities that allow all functions to collaborate in real time and lastly improve the first-time issue resolution to 90% for all countries in scope.

Direct Reports: 9 in frontline/ 3 in Global Service Centre.
Business or sector Shipping and Supply Chain
profile_positions.title: Customer Service General Manager - Caribbean Area (interim)

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the customer experience of Maersk Panama, including process improvements with Shared Service Centres and Operations Liaison for the cluster with Liner Operations Center for Latin America.

-Responsible to secure best in the industry service level for Panama market 45,000 FFE’s, (forty-foot equivalent unit). Rolling Forecast.

Main achievements:

-Highest score card results among the countries within the Caribbean cluster which quantified the service promise: Phone attendance %, invoicing quality, documentation accuracy and timeliness, booking confirmation etc.
-Customer Effort (CER 30% reduction). Deployment of a continuous E-commerce campaign over 2015, Implementation of a performance routine and On- Boarding program that contributed to reduce the customer’s interactions in 30% compared to 2014. 

Position reporting to: Cluster Customer Service Manager
Direct Reports: 8 
Business or sector Shipping and Logistics
profile_positions.title: Country Customer Service Manager - Panama

profile_positions.description:
This position was based in Panama and it was fundamentally focus on deliver strong differentiator service packages to the customers assigned to this segmentation. 

As part of the managerial role, analysing the customers profile, and ensuring the compliance of volume on quarterly basis was critical as the Premium Segment requires tailormade solutions and dedicated staff. 

Hence, managing a team that could comply with such requirements demanded  key capabilities like  constant performance monitor, strong frive and focus, coaching and communication skills as well as leadership
profile_positions.title: Customer Experience Manager - Premium Segment  Panama

profile_positions.description:
Lead first migration of a LATAM cluster into an offshore business model. Responsible for the implementation of all the local procedures of Mexico, and Central America countries to be executed in Manila, by ensuring top quartile service delivery.

Main achievements:

-Successful migration of more than 20 Core and 30 sub- processes for 5 different countries (Mexico, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras and Nicaragua).

-Integration of a multi-cultural team gathering the best capabilities of individuals to secure business continuity embedding the change management culture.

-Facilitator / trainer of a large team (25 team members) in all the main countries processes and dynamics, most importantly transmitting the business understanding to an organization that works more on a process basis, this allowed the project to overcome the learning curve faster and gain additional improvements compared to the original baseline in record time. (4-6 months)

Position reporting to: Cluster Extended off -shored office Lead
Direct Reports 17

Business or sector Shipping and Logistics
profile_positions.title: Offshore Operations - Back office Customer Service Manager - Central America & Mexico

profile_positions.description:

As Process Support, responsible for the KPIs of the organization, process improvements, risks and mitigations as well as implementation of action plans as the result of the analysis of the metrics under evaluation.

-Position reporting to: Customer Service Manager

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the assigned customer portfolio, including all activities related to service delivery and customer experience.
